title: Adding Joint with parent "world" to model causes it to rocket to a specific location in world

content.raw:
If I add a joint with parent set to `world` to a model, the model will rocket to a specific location in the world (world attached). I expect the model to not move when the simulation starts (there is no gravity in this world).

When the simulation loads the model is near the ground. The joint is attached to the top link, with pose set to be just above it.

![prismatic_on_world.png](data/bitbucket.org/repo/jgXqbo/images/1472593659-prismatic_on_world.png)

After unpausing the simulation, the model moves so quickly it appears to teleport.

![teleporting_prismatic_joint.gif](data/bitbucket.org/repo/jgXqbo/images/1935137438-teleporting_prismatic_joint.gif)

It does not actually teleport. The model experiences a huge force upwards, and then  more force to slow it down to the resting position. This takes about 50 ticks to complete.

Z component of force on top link

![force_spreadsheet.png](data/bitbucket.org/repo/jgXqbo/images/1154502881-force_spreadsheet.png)

Z velocity of top link

![velocity_z_screenshot.png](data/bitbucket.org/repo/jgXqbo/images/526553254-velocity_z_screenshot.png)

I tried a prismatic and a ball joint. Both had the same rocket ship behavior.

Gazebo Version 7.5.0
